title: Banners: Verify an Ad Banner can be added to the scoreboard
custom_preconds:
Given that Developer or Ad Ops help is provided
And the Developer has setup an Ad Banner for the Scoreboard
custom_expected: Then an Ad Banner is seen on the scoreboard

title: Banners: Test a Banner that isn't closeable
custom_preconds:
Given that Developer or Ad Ops help is provided
And the Developer has setup the unclose-able banner
custom_expected:
Then we should see the banner
And we shouldn't be able to close the banner

title: Banners: Test a Banner that is closeable.
custom_preconds:
Given that Developer or Ad Ops help is provided
And the Developer has added a banner that can be closed
custom_expected:
Then we can see the Banner
And if we close the Banner it will not be visible again

title: Banners: Verify an Ad Banner can open an internal webview
custom_preconds:
Given that Developer or Ad Ops help is provided
And the banner is hyper-linked to a URL that should be open in an internal webview
custom_steps: When we tap on the banner
custom_expected:
Then Safari will NOT launch
And the user will see the webview open in an internal view 
And the user will be able to easily navigate back to the app

title: Banners: Verify an Ad Banner can open an external webview
custom_preconds:
Given that Developer or Ad Ops help is provided
And the banner is hyper-linked to a URL that should be open in an external webview
custom_steps: When we tap on the banner
custom_expected:
Then Safari will launch
And the user will see the webview open in an external view
And the user will have to background the webview to return to the app manually

title: Banners: Verify an Ad Banner can launch a video stream
custom_preconds:
Given that Developer or Ad Ops help is provided
And the banner is linked to a video stream
custom_steps: When we tap on the banner
custom_expected:
Then the video will launch using the native media player
And the stream will play without issue

title: Banners: Verify an Ad Banner can be removed
custom_preconds:
Given that Developer or Ad Ops help is provided
And the Developer has removed the banner
custom_expected: Then the banner should be removed from the location it was previously showing at

title: Banners: Verify we have the ability to target Ad Marvel ads
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate to Scoreboard (or whichever page Dev or Ad Ops has placed the ad banner)
custom_expected: THEN we are able to successfully target specific ads

title: Notifications: Verify notifications only display once per session and should not appear again in subsequent sessions
custom_preconds: Set up pop-up notifications via QA Homebase
custom_expected:
Then we should see the popup notification only once per session
And when the popup notification has been closed we will not see it again

title: Notifications: After closing out of a notification when a new one is created then that one is received by the device
custom_preconds:
Set up pop-up notifications via QA Homebase
And then create another popup
custom_expected: Then the new popup is received

title: Pop-up Notifications: Popups will have a button that can close it
custom_preconds:
Set up pop-up notifications via QA Homebase
And then create a popup with a button

title: Pop-Up Notifications: Popups that have a button linked to an internal web page will open that web page
custom_preconds:
Set up pop-up notifications via QA Homebase
And then create a multi-button popup
And then one of the buttons has been linked to a web page
custom_steps: When clicking the button linked to an internal web page
custom_expected: Then the web page opens in an internal view

title: Pop-Up Notifications: Popups that have a button linked to an external web page will open that web page
custom_preconds:
Set up pop-up notifications via QA Homebase
And the create a multi-button popup
And the one of the buttons has been linked to a web page
custom_steps: When clicking the button linked to an external web page
custom_expected: Then the web page opens in an external view (safari browser)
